title: Amperes law - partially hollow conducting cylinder

content.question: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> shows a hollow cylindrical conductor. The outer region of the conductor has a constant current density of magnitude <math alttext="J sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> directed in the negative <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>z</mi></math>-direction, as shown. The central, hollow region of the cylinder carries no current. Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> shows an enlarged cross-sectional view of the conductor, along with three square regions labeled <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>. Region <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is within the hollow portion of the cylinder but offset from the central axis, Region <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is in the solid portion where there is current, and Region <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> is outside the cylinder.(a) Inside the square for each region in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, indicate the direction of the magnetic field, if any, at the center of the square. To indicate the field direction, draw one of the symbols shown in the bottom row of the “Symbols” table in the figure. If the magnetic field is zero or negligible in any region, write “zero” just below that region.
